arts.ttl: Birmingham City player ratings after Laird and Iwata shine in Leyton Orient win
arts.sum: Taylor Gardner-Hickman’s first goal for Blues and a third of 2025 for the in-form Ethan Laird clinched another win for Chris Davies’ side. Blues deservedly took the lead eight minutes into the second half when Gardner-Hickman fired home from close range.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies disagrees with Richie Wellens and hails Birmingham City quality
arts.sum: Davies said: “It was always going to be a tricky test for us, first 10 to 15 minutes was a bit scrappy, then obviously the red card put them down to 10 men and they went very defensive at that point – a 5-3-1 shape, a really low block. Birmingham City defeated Leyton Orient 2-0 at St Andrew's courtesy of goals from Taylor Gardner-Hickman and Ethan Laird

arts.ttl: Richie Wellens slams two Birmingham City calls and raises EFL question after Leyton Orient defeat
arts.sum: A frustrated Wellens, who felt aggrieved with Currie’s red card and what he believed was a foul in the build-up to Gardner-Hickman’s opening goal, reflected: “I don’t understand how there’s hardly any Premier League games today, and there’s hardly any Championship games, why can’t we have a referee from that level? Richie Wellens insists his Leyton Orient side were on the wrong side of two decisions and questioned why a Championship referee didn’t take charge of their defeat to Birmingham City.

arts.ttl: Birmingham extend lead at League One summit with victory over 10-man Orient
arts.sum: The visitors were dealt an early blow when Jack Currie was sent off for a late lunging challenge on Tomoki Iwata.

arts.ttl: Spurs injury news: Ange Postecoglou delivers Ben Davies update ahead of Manchester City Premier League fixture
arts.sum: Tottenham Hotspur head coach Ange Postecoglou provides an update on the availability of a key defender ahead of Wednesday's Premier League game against Manchester City.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City vs Leyton Orient - TV details, live coverage and team news
arts.sum: Orient arrive having lost to Bolton last time out – but still in a good run of form with five wins from their last seven league matches and in sixth place in the table. Birmingham City play one of their two games in hand this evening when they welcome Leyton Orient to League One’s only unconquered outpost.

arts.ttl: Stansfield, Leonard, Anderson: Birmingham City injury latest before Leyton Orient
arts.sum: Blues travelled to the Select Car Leasing Stadium without talisman Jay Stansfield after their 20-goal top scorer sustained a leg injury against Bradford City last week. Scott Wright and Lyndon Dykes' names were added to Birmingham City's injury list during the 0-0 draw with Reading at the weekend.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City v Wrexham Vertu Trophy final disruption plan emerges
arts.sum: Darren Ferguson acknowledges that Peterborough United's priority is to preserve their League One status come the end of the season - but that won't stop Posh trying to deny the 'Hollywood Derby' final of Birmingham City v Wrexham in the Vertu Trophy final at Wembley in April. Birmingham City are heading to Wembley for the Vertu Trophy final in April - on Wednesday they'll discover if they're playing Peterborough or Wrexham

arts.ttl: How has Jordan James fared since leaving Birmingham City for £8m?
arts.sum: Birmingham City were mainly focused on incomings last summer, but one big departure from St. Andrew’s was midfielder… The post How has Jordan James fared since leaving Birmingham City for £8m? appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

Birmingham were held to a goalless draw at Reading on Saturday, but it still extended their unbeaten run to 16 games and was enough to keep them six points clear of Wycombe. The Blues have won their ...
